attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2005-1967

Date: 2005-11-15

Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport and the Treasury Board, pursuant to subsection 16(1) of the Federal Real Property and Federal Immovables Act, hereby authorizes the Minister of Transport, on behalf of Her Majesty in right of Canada:

 

(a) to enter into agreements, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Schedule I to this Order, with the following airport authorities:

 

(i) Aéroports de Montréal,

(ii) The Calgary Airport Authority,

(iii) Edmonton Regional Airports Authority,

(iv) Greater Toronto Airports Authority,

(v) Halifax International Airport Authority,

(vi) Ottawa Macdonald-Cartier International Airport Authority,

(vii) Vancouver International Airport Authority,

(viii) Victoria Airport Authority, and

(ix) Winnipeg Airports Authority Inc.;

 

(b) to enter into agreements, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Schedule II to this Order, with the following Airport Authorities:

 

(i) Regina Airport Authority,

(ii) Saskatoon Airport Authority,

(iii) St. John’s International Airport Authority,

(iv) Aéroport de Québec inc., and

(v) Thunder Bay International Airports Authority Inc.;


(c) to enter into agreements, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Schedule III to this Order, with the following Airport Authorities:

 

(i) Greater Fredericton Airport Authority Inc.,

(ii) Gander International Airport Authority Inc.,

(iii) Prince George Airport Authority Inc., and

(iv) Saint John Airport Inc.; and

 

(d) to enter into agreements, substantially in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in Schedule IV to this Order, with the following Airport Authorities:

 

(i) Charlottetown Airport Authority Inc.,

(ii) Greater London International Airport Authority, and

(iii) Greater Moncton International Airport Authority Inc.,

 

to amend the Ground Leases between Her Majesty in right of Canada and those airport authorities in order to implement the new airport rent policy.


Sur recommandation du ministre des Transports et du Conseil du Trésor et en vertu de l’article 16 de la Loi sur les immeubles fédéraux et les biens réels fédéraux, Son Excellence la Gouverneure générale en conseil autorise le ministre des Transports à conclure, au nom de Sa Majesté du chef du Canada :

 

a) des accords, conformes en substance aux conditions figurant à l’annexe I ci-jointe, avec les administrations aéroportuaires suivantes :

 

(i) Aéroports de Montréal,

(ii) The Calgary Airport Authority,

(iii) Edmonton Regional Airports Authority,

(iv) Greater Toronto Airports Authority,

(v) Halifax International Airport Authority,

(vi)  Administration de l’aéroport international Macdonald-         Cartier d’Ottawa,

(vii) Vancouver International Airport Authority,

(viii) Victoria Airport Authority,

(ix) Winnipeg Airports Authority Inc.;

 

b) des accords, conformes en substance aux conditions figurant à l’annexe II ci-jointe, avec les administrations aéroportuaires suivantes :

 

(i)  Regina Airport Authority,

(ii) Saskatoon Airport Authority,

(iii) St. John’s International Airport Authority,

(iv) Aéroport de Québec inc.,


(v) Thunder Bay International Airports Authority Inc.;

(c) des accords, conformes en substance aux conditions figurant à l’annexe III ci-jointe, avec les administrations aéroportuaires suivantes : 

 

(i) Greater Fredericton Airport Authority Inc.,

(ii) Gander International Airport Authority Inc.,

(iii) Prince George Airport Authority Inc.,

(iv) Saint John Airport Inc.;

 

(d) des accords, conformes en substance aux conditions figurant à l’annexe IV ci-jointe, avec les administrations aéroportuaires suivantes : 

 

(i) Charlottetown Airport Authority Inc.,

(ii) Greater London International Airport Authority,

(iii) Greater Moncton International Airport Authority Inc.

 

Les accords ont pour objet de modifier les baux fonciers entre Sa Majesté et ces administrations aéroportuaires afin de mettre en oeuvre la nouvelle politique sur le loyer des aéroports.
